sequence: <size=51>"But thou, why goest thou back to such annoyance?</size>
<size=51>Why climb'st thou not the Mount Delectable,</size>
<size=51>Which is the source and cause of every joy?"</size>
<size=51>Please teach me, my teacher, please save me, my savior.</size>
<size=51>In the name of the God you never knew,</size>
<size=51>Help me escape this woe and torment.</size>
<size=51>Take me to the place of which you spoke,</size>
<size=51>That I may see the gate of Saint Peter,</size>
<size=51>And the souls of those so tormented.</size>

scripts.say: And in the end, they never came?
Correct. We informed the Iron Blood as soon as we engaged the Royal Navy.
They said something about "night battle having too many unknown variables," but all I heard was a bunch of verbal garbage.
Looks like we were never more than cannon fodder to them, just like the Vichya Dominion.
I was full of hope when we were brought into the Crimson Axis...
But it looks like we are just pawns for their "Reenactment."
It's almost time for the denouement, Veneto.
Indeed. This "Reenactment" is about to come to an end. The only thing left for us... is to decide whether it ends as a comedy or as a tragedy...
